what a way to relax. Awesome. Just a leisurely stroll here makes all the difference in the world. went here for a walk with the kids before dinner, and caught a glimpse of the sunset too. kids played in the park while my husband and I enjoyed the views.and they even have gym equipment.

Nice little park near the ocean. Greenpoint Urban Park is a nice small little urban park very close to Cape Town stadium and the ocean. It is actually somewhat difficult to find - we had to drive around for a few minutes to find the parking space - but once located it is easy and safe to move around. (Security guards greet you when you enter.) The park has various types of plants and placards about traditional KhoiKhoi diets and lifestyles, as well as discussion about biodiversity. It is a short walk to reach Greenpoint lighthouse and the ocean as well.
Fun. Enjoyed wandering around this park. Activities for the kids, dogs can be walked, people just chilling.

what a great place. the park was establish in an effort to uplift the neglected part of green point when cape town hosted the world soccer cup in 2010 and the new stadium was built on the huge empty grounds.i remember how sceptical people in the area was and i'm happy the park turned out to be such a great success. it's a wonderful short cut from greenpoint village down to mouille point and the light house. it's open between 7am-7pm. there is great playgrounds for children of different ages and on weekends a lot of the suburbians comes in for pic-nic

The best place in Cape Town to take your kids and family!. The best place in Cape Town to take your kids and family when the weather plays with. The kids park is awesome and has plenty of activities for the little ones to hangout on. There's a path to ride bikes or skate and plenty of lawn for cricket / soccer. You can't NOT go to this place!

Peace and quiet in the city. A stroll through can take anything from 10mins to a few hours. The noise of the main road gets blocked out. Large lawns, restrooms (kept very clean), play areas for children, an outside excersise area, security, biodiversity garden... there are always children playing, whether with families or a school group, and various birds interrupting your thoughts. The feel of it is surreal for inner city, like a piece of heaven where all is good (clean, safe...) and happy :-) no fees, but it has certain opening and closing times

Gorgeous fun for the whole family. Such a stunning park with beautiful views and manicured park gardens. Perfect for a run, stroll or picnic. Close to the sea point promenade so you can skip over and walk along the sea too.

An asset to Cape Town. Beautifully designed, family friendly, peaceful park - this is such a welcome addition to Cape Town. Perfect for a picnic or early morning exercise or just a stroll. Everytime I visit this park I feel happy.

Family Fun. What a gem, a pleasure to see so many families of all walks of life enjoying a day out in the sun. The facilities are fantastic, find yourself a tree to laze under, enjoy a picnic and watch the world go by.
Nice clean park. Great park to chill out and great play areas for kids. Walking distance from the famous Waterfront and city center.

Take a walk in the park. This lovely Park and biodiversity garden that has been created near the New Green Point Stadium.There are different themed areas, for example: medicinal herb garden. wetlands area, Fynbos area, cactus garden, and seaside garden. It is both informative and enjoyable. I highly recommend a vist to this park area, as it is relaxing and interesting, to be enjoyed by both children and adults alike.

well worth the visit. an old fashioned picnic site. Clean, well managed, despite their being no entrance charge. They do check that you dont carry any alcohol in, which I thought good. And you cant erect any "structure" such a gazebo or similar. Just looking to chill with the children, very good venue to do it.
Lovely free park. This is a lovely free park with loads of activities for the youngsters. Limited shade and can be quite over run with people of the weekends.
Interesting. The walk through the park is interesting especially the educational section about the flora. The outdoor gym area is worth a visit if you feel like some exercise.

Kids LOVE it!. Brilliant place for a family outing. Love the atmosphere and fun. Creative jungle gyms are super. Bring own picnic / food / drinks. There is typically an ice cream vendor outside the park, but that's all.

Peaceful. An absolutely gorgeous park,very peaceful
Great place for a picnic with family and friends
Lovely to just walk and enjoy
Visited many times during my stay

It feels like London. A biodiversity garden on our own doorstep? Fantastic. Safe and easy area to jog in, easy access from all sides and enough space to sneak away for a quiet picnic or host a big kiddies party with enough legroom to run and fall softly on green grass.

An excellent eaxample of planning for the people. Wonderful and superbly used by all sorts of people and well maintained, like an old fashioned UK municipal park where there is pride and no evidence of misuse, safe and fascinating. A credit to cape Town Municipality. UK government should take note at what we are losing!!
Great experience. Great easy walk with amazing information. Highly recommended and very valuable information. Great for kids and good option is a associated picnic.

FAMILY PICKNICK PARK. A great park for young and old esp kids, there is a park for the kids enough space for young and not so young to cycle safetly while you have a picknick only problem there is very little shade so come protected for the hot days and there is also security around
A park to educate and inform. Stunning green belt in the middle of the city. Well maintained and informative at the same time. Worth a visit for sure.

Urban Awesomeness!. Kid friendly, dog friendly, bike friendly, well maintained, well equipped (clean public loo's, 2 playgrounds, outdoor gym, picnic facilities etc). It really is a wondeful place. The only downfall is that it would be nice for the park to have a refreshment stand, as we sometimes cut our visits short to go and find something to quench our thirst!

A great way to spend time in Cape Town. Greenpoint Park is beside the stadium and has ample parking nearby. It is free to enter via a couple of gates and has a large area of gardens with very interesting explanations about biodiversity, plants which are indigenous to the area and invaders which are threatening the environment. It really is extremely well planned and attractive. There are large areas of grass with numerous people having picnics and attractive water areas. You can leave and walk to the ocean within minutes and at all times the view of the mountains are stunning, A great way to spend a few very enjoyable hours.

Relaxing and a favourite. Likely one of my favourite places in Cape Town. I never miss an opportunity to go to Greenpoint park.Such an open area away from traffic and the hustle bustle of town with the beautiful mountain views and the smell of the sea!We usually grab a cappuccino from Giovanni's or an ice cream and stroll through. Been known to picnic on the big grassy areas too!

Best option in CT, but had issues. This is probably the best option for a park to play in for kids in Cape Town - there aren't too many alternatives (maybe we are spoilt by having half a dozen within walking distance).I took my under 6 kids to play in the dedicated play area. There was a reasonable selection of equipment, but it was very crowded (I guess lack of supply), and I didn't think the ground was overly forgiving for falls off some equipment that is quite high for toddlers.Also, there was no-one stopping older kids from using the facilities either.If you're in Cape Town and your kids need to have a run out, this is one of the better options. Compared to others across the world, it's average.Admittedly, we didn't use any of the other facilities. Also, it's worth noting that parking was accessible.
Good Break. great place to chill out-just a couple blocks from the waterfront-however no dogs-you could do a picnic or just walk around-close to public transportation.
nice park for a walk. wonderful park near the world cup stadium! Nice lay out, and a great park for kids to play in. A great place to go for a run or walk.
freshness. When you walk in this park, you refresh yourself not only your body but also your soul. It is definitely a place to visit in Cape Town. You can do jogging, ride your bicycle.

Opportunity to see endemic plants. Pleasant, well cared for gardens. Some very old trees and plants. Lots of pidgins to feed if that is your thing. Ends on one end at the Museum which has some interesting exhibits.

a fabulous walk, lovely environment. we walked twice and enjoyed every minute of it. a great achievement and a real leisurely promenade . these are the things which make Capetown a special place in south Africa

A park for everyone. So deserving of its many design awards, this beautifully landscaped park is truly a park for everyone, young and old, to enjoy. There are several children's playgrounds, all age related, which is so good for little ones who might otherwise be overwhelmed by older children. It is wonderful to watch children enjoying parties and educational programmes at the outdoor amphitheatre. There is also an outdoor gym, labyrinth and many areas to explore, including a biodiversity garden with lovely walks and interesting facts, indigenous plants and many trees. The park is spotlessly clean and well maintained and there are lovely areas to sit beside the lake or beneath the trees and enjoy the incredibly peaceful setting. Signal Hill and Cape Town Stadium form imposing backdrops. It would be nice to have a place to sit and enjoy a coffee but there are so many great coffee shops and restaurants around Green Point, Mouille Point and The Waterfront, nearby. So wonderful, I wish this park had been done years ago.

Perfect stop. Loved the park..we had kids and after a day of touring was a good spot to stop and have them play, run around, climb. They have a mini golf park which is quite nicely done. On the overall a great spot for families

A great park to take the kids or just hang out in.. this is a cool park. lots of fun obstacles for kids. areas to ride and skateboard. a outdoor gym. needs a coffee place but other than that it is perfect and immaculately kept. wish we had one in joburg
Great park and lovely play areas. Safe, clean, green and popular with locals and tourists. Play areas for children of different ages. Lovely walks through biodiversity garden. Really worth a visit!

Invaded by .... it's not the first time this was mentioned: A few parties essentially take over the garden on weekends. Bringing all their equipment, essentially moving in with the full tut, just short of the kitchen sink. I suggest to impose rules as in Kirstenbosch. No chairs, no gazebos, no tables. Visitors, stay away on weekends.
Nice area to relax in Cape Town. At greenpoint park you find a nice area to relax from the city noise. Just close to the waterfront and the stadium. Jogging, relaxing, everything is possible.

Lovely place. Well thought out, with plenty of activities for all ages along with beautiful ocean views, eateries along the way, toilets nearby. The garden was amazing - we loved the wide walkways and the different garden 'rooms'. Beautiful

Place to picnic & relax. I am so impressed with this new addition to the Atlantic seaboard. A lovely green area, with paths, fountains, lakes & pergola with benches. A kiddies playground, plenty of refuse bins, not to mention the amazing view of the mountains and the sea. Really enjoyed our picnic lunch purchased from a deli on Main Road, Green Point.

Urban park in Cape Town. The Green Point urban park was born in the wake of the world cup and transformed a somewhat run-down commons into a lovely urban park which attracts one and all. The biodiversity garden is a lovely quick view of the immense diversity of the Cape vegetation.

Wonderful. What a treasure this oasis in the middle of the hustle and bustle is. Lovely for families and such a restful atmostphere. Well run and maintained - an absolute treasure worth a visit - just make sure you have time to while away some well spent hours!

Innovative and impressive educational facility. As out of towners, our visit to Greenpoint Park was not about kids playing or seeking a picnic spot, but about discovering what we were told was one of Cape Town's more interesting new parklands. Well it is terrific with open greenspace but so much more for here is an interesting park design supplemented with innovative interpretative programmes, some whimsical and fun, some with serious intent but expressed in a clear and easily understood way. This is urban park design at its best with native plants used extensively. Everybody will find something to please them at Greenpoint but those wishing to understand the issues of managing and conserving Cape Town's flora will be most satisfied.
Peaceful and tranquil. In the middle of the hustle and bustle,yet it feels like you are in the countryside.Drinking water facilities,stunning garden to walk your dog.Security in place,safe.
Cool to see. I had some free time so I drove over to this stadium. Very easy to get to and easy to see from many parts of the city. Worth seeing if you have some extra time in Cape Town

A great place to picnic with the kids, walk the dogs or ride bikes. The playground at the park reminds me of European playgrounds - great equipment, rubberised surrounds, lots to do. But I love the surrounding of indigenous gardens and being a stones throw from the Mouille Point boulevard. Easy to pop over for a nice take-away latte or a lunch.We've had picnics here and taken the kids bikes along as it's a nice big safe space for them to ride or run around. They also loved the indigenous gardens with explanations about the traditional uses of plants and kept asking questions. Only downside - it can get a bit crowded on weekends, but there is enough equipment for everyone.
Great place for a free kids outing. Popped in here with my kids, clean, very well equipped, and fun, security was right there too. Loved the playgrounds, only a pity it is only for kids under 12.
Well worth a visit. Flora and fauna outstanding! Cape shown at its best and lots of facilities too. Spacious clean and safe, lots of security.

Excellent place to use up some energy. After Signal Hill, this was our first stop in Cape Town, recommended by our hosts, and it was absolutely brilliant as a place to allow our children to wear off energy after their long plane journey south. We spent ages here as they tried every aspect of the jungle gym and the fitness centre, and also, inevitably, used the toilets. The atmosphere was great, and it says easy to get to and from.
great view of the city. You must go there the view of the city is great from this point. Don't missthis point you can take great pictures from there.

A must-visit place in Cape Town. I love this park! I can remember when the area was basically wasteland and it's now been developed into a wonderfully magical place that's educational, entertaining and relaxing to visit. Learn all about biodiversity and more, let the kids play in the amazing playgrounds which have been designed to fit in with their natural surroundings and simply enjoy the setting You'll have fabulous views of Signal Hill, the ocean, the emerald green fairways of the Metropolitan golf course and, of course, the amazing modern stadium build for the Fifa World Cup 2010. Take a picnic and spend some time, you won't believe you're in the middle of a city.

Amazing park for family and friends. Lots of parking, easy to access on the My-Citi bus service.Place to picnic, jungle gyms for the children to play on, pet friendly (on a leash) and lots of amenities with tapped spring water (free to drink out of the water fountains).... Really could one ask for more??And then the diversity gardens introduce visitors to some of the biomes of the Western Cape. And if you are fortunate you will catch site of some of the wildlife too!!
A great day out. Perfect for a picnic and it has a large variety of play equipment for kids of all ages to enjoy. Also lots of space for kids to bring bikes.

Surprise Treat. This Park was across the street (and 2 roads) from our hotel, but it took me days to discover it. There are nice little touches to it - it's mostly a large green space - such as a human sun dial (it was so so strange to see the sun in the Northern Sky!), exercise stations, and a discovery garden. It is located between the new stadium and the esplanade, a delightful walking / running path along the ocean sea walls, and is a 5-10 minute walk to the V&A Waterfront.
beautiful, peaceful, lovely for kids. there are picnic spots.There are equipment for kids(aged 7 and up) to play on.There are ponds.It is perfect for a family picnic.There are always people around
best park i have seen. just do it, if only we had park like this in the UK. I have never come across a park so well used, This park as something for everyone

Interesting.. The biodiversity garden is a tranquil haven in the city. It is a popular place for adults and children alike to relax and see indigenous flora at its best. The fynbos is unique to the western cape and the proteas, Ericas and restios fascinating.
Urban park. Tis newly built urban park is the only one of its kind in Cape Town. A beautiful place to either exercise or take the kids for a picnic. Free entry with a peaceful atmosphere.
Great for small kids. Lots of jungle gyms & a well laid out play area for children of all ages. Bring a picnic & a ball to kick around.
Simply amazing. A stunning park which is also very educational we'll worth a visit - again you can jump of the red bus as it passes on the way to the waterfront.
Great place. Relaxing, fun & easy place to take kids as bikes are welcome and lots of security. Great for picnics or family get togethers.Walks or cycling.
BEAUTIFUL VARIETY OF FAUNA. The Gardens offer a wide variety of plants, flowers, and trees that can be found in the Cape Town area. Pack a lunch and spend a relaxing afternoon.

Love Love Love. This is the greatest park. It is completely free and magnificently kept. There is something for all ages from play areas to picnic areas to biodiversity and history information. Watch out for the hidden wire and metal animals dotted around in the bushes! A lovely touch.

Great City park. If you and/or your kids are looking for a park to stretch your legs for a while then this municipal park is an excellent place to visit. There are paths to walk on, a biodiversity garden, lots of lawns as well as play equipment for different age groups. There are also well-maintained toilets.Infomation from the City of Cape Town website:The Green Point Park is open every day from 07:00 until 19:00.* Picnics are permitted* Swimming, skateboarding, fires, braais, camping, loud music, flower picking and alcohol are not permitted* Dogs are welcome in the park, provided that they are on a lead and owners pick up and dispose of their excrement. Dogs are not allowed in the biodiversity garden* Parking is available near the entrances on the corner of Beach/Vlei Roads; on Bill Peters Drive (near the entrance to the Virgin Active gym); and on Bay Road (near the Mouille Point lighthouse).*The park has an outdoor gym and play park

a wonderful place to wander. A really good mix of leisure and educational areas so close to the city centre. I particularly enjoyed the edible plants sections. Good way to stroll from the Waterfront along the Promenade to lovely Seapoint and some great local restaurants.

A Beautiful Park in a Wonderful Setting. A great facility for young and old in the shadow of Cape Town's stadium. I have no love for the stadium but as a result of building this white elephant, Capetonians have been bequeathed this beautiful park.

Fantastic place to relax with family. What a lovely place that is cost effective and fun and most of all SAFE. Perfect for kids of all ages to run and play or just relax and look at the bird life. Planning to go back soon. Also not just to have fun but learn as well with all the information boards in the area.

Beautiful Mother Nature. FRom a distance you will not know of this hidden treasure. It is very educational and brings you closer to how an eco-system should function. This is a journey every person who gets to this part of the world should take. I love the watering holes, the water is so pure and refreshing. This is the place to spend one's weekends reflecting on what each person can do to restore what nature gave us, and how we can leave this world to be appreciated and enjoyed by future generations.

Green template. This is a wonderful opportunity to see green gardening, an exceptional visual presentation which is beautiful in itself, but also extremely educational in terms of bio diversity, ecology and how easy & important such green gardening is.

Fabulous garden in central Cape Town. The Greenpoint park is a must see on a Cape Town visit. It is beautifully planned with fascinating and beautifully signed information on South Africa's biodiversity. It's clean, wonderfully laid out and has fabulous views of the mountain.

Great with Children and for Gym. Unique setting, views and scenery.Safe and lots to do with children: great fun park for different age groups, outdoor gym, biodiversity promenade, shaded picnic areas, water fountains.Easy access, from Virgin Active Green Point or via Mouilles point counter alleys, lots of parking.
Day out with the kids. Ample space for the kids, beautiful surroundings and safe play area with place to sit and watch them in contentment. No litter and hawkers or beggers.
Great Public Park!. Amazingly laid out park in the heart of Cape Town. Great for walks, or a jog, or for a picnic with the family! There is also a wonderful and very original play park for kids.
beautiful. and to think this was built of rock bed covered with green waste from the City! yes all soil and compost used in the park is composted by Reliance Compost from the Waste the City generates

How green is my Cape Town. The Greenpoint Park is a blue print for biodiversity displays and makes it practical and fun for all ages to understand conservation. It is a family destination and fitness fanatics can be seen walking for running through the park at any time. Despite the action the park remains a tranquil space.
Cool Set up. We went as a Group with my German visitors and every body enjoyed the walk through, and they find it wonderful that the facility is near the Center of Town and available to all people

Lovely place to take the kids. An awesome place to take the kids to play on the educational/outdoor equipment, enjoy outdoor life, experience an affinity with nature, learn about flora and take in the beautiful views of Table Mountain and vicinity at no charge. Amazing view of The Cape Town Stadium too. Take a picnic and enjoy a fun family day out on the beautiful lawns.
Biodiversity. Cape Town in a nutshell! Diverse, fun and chilled garden in the heart of a bustling city. I highly recommend a visit here!
Beautiful!. Walked from the Waterfront, through the park, to Seapoint. Super nice walk. Loved the layout of the park. It was really quiet on a sunny afternoon. Highly recommended!

A Community park in the city. Situated close to the City and adjacent to the Cape Town Stadium, etropolitan Golf Club and the Mouillie Point Lighthouse this is an excellent and safe venue for families. Not only is it beautifully laid out with indienous plantings, lawns and ponds but it contains two child play areas with swings etc - one for young children and the other for older kids. Picnic tables are provided under shade for those who just wnat to sit outside and enjoy the ambiance.
Excellent park close to Cape Town stadium. Stunning spot to walk with the kids. Close to stadium and Greenpoint golf course. Magic climbing apparatus and jungle gyms plus fitness equipment.
Best park in CT. Space, scenery, plenty for children to keep active and busy, good for picnics, and wonderful to walk around - beautifully tended and in a great location (apart from when it's windy)

A great addition to Mouille Points platinum mile. This new park is situated opposite the lighthouse and is so peaceful to walk around. It is ideal for little children and adults too. It is so peaceful and the view from the apartments in front of them are stupendous. They occassionally have concerts in the park too.

A walk in the park. This park is well worth a visit. My wife and I strolled through on a lazy, sunny sunday. Lovely views over the Milnerton Golf Course, as well as of Table Mountain await. The gardens are very interesting and well laid out, with an area for children to play as well as places to sit and take in the ambience. We were pleasantly surprised.

This is what a park is meant to be like!. This park has brought to Cape Town something which it needed years ago! A place where kids can be! Yes it is a safe enviroment for kids of all ages, from 1 to 101. Chidren love it for all the free running space and park structures which have been set up according to age, so the toddlers wont have to get underfoot of the older more boisterous kids. It has a lovely picnic area where countless birthday parties are held on a daily basis. Of course the area is limited so most people come early in order to "book" their space. The more senior citizens also enjoy the large ares where you can walk in a safe environment as the whole area is closely monitored by helpful staff both security and other.The only drawback of the whole area is the lack of an eatery of some sort- an inexpensive coffee shop type of establishment is just what this place needs! Perhaps the City Fathers should look at the viability of this.All in all, just the place to unwind, practice your yoga or tai-chi or just relax!
Little paradise!. A perfect place for a family day out, or just read a book on a park bench! Spent a family afternoon on the weekend. Next time plan to go for a picnic.

Tranquillity but so close to the excitement.. In Sea Point after the Cycletour race last Sunday, decided to take a run in the direction of Moulle Point. A running race was in progress so decided to see the finish, which, it so happened, was through this park to the outside of the magnificent stadium.I walked and ran through the park and was amazed at the fish pools, water wheel, explanations of the area at all points of interest. This coupled with the views, and places to picnic, with facilities for children, so near the built up area, is a find that must be seen to be appreciated.

Perfection. We have just spent a month in Cape Town and came across the park and walked there every day.There is some great exercise equipment which has been supplied by Rotary even my husband who does not go to the gym used it!Also perfect childrens play equipment.Very friendly and informative with all the bio diversity areas..great for all ages and well worth visitingLots of parking areas and good security
Just peaceful. I love the tranquil park and open space, great to sit in park with friends and the beautiful views from park
Tranquil space in the city. Lovely kept gardens, nice place for a picnic or stroll. It seemed to be a family friendly park and a peaceful haven in the city centre.Well worth a look

Wonderful facilities. My children and I spent a wonderful day yesterday at the Green point urban park...wow, a first class facility, with amazing apparatus for kids of all ages, especially the older ones who get a bit bored with the average jungle gym. We strolled, and learnt about biodiversity and played and even did some exercice, and all left wanting to come back next time properly armed with a picnic so we could spend a few hours there!!

So enjoyed it. Had no idea it was such an interesting place to walk around . Every corner has a surprise and a great view. There were paths leading through bio diversity gardens, alongside waterways and wonderful children's play areas. The day we went there were schoolchildren having fun on the large wooden seesaw and all the different swings etc.There were friendly security guards around and the whole place had a good feel about it. A great asset to Cape Town and we were told it is very busy at weekends so if you like a quiet walk around maybe choose a weekday.

A piece of heaven..... This is one of the best things to have come out of the 2010 World Cup Football in Cape Town. We finally have a park, that is not only beautiful, but designed with integrity from start to finish.I love that this is a park for children, and the security get strict if grown ups play with or on the funky slides, swings and other interesting creations.One of my favourite aspects is the labyrinth - and it is open to all people to walk throughout the day

Pleasantly surprised.. I thought that the park might be boring, but it is really lovely with many interesting little areas and lots of information. It has a great atmosphere and is in a lovely area close to the sea, stadium and Green Point Lighthouse, which is well worth a visit. The lighthouse is small, but has great views and a small exhibit. I loved being at both places. There is a small fee for the lighthouse.

Great open space for families to play and picnic. Soft green lawns, areas with tables for picnics and parties, jungle jims for kids to clamber on, large areas for ball games, interesting walkways and planted gardens. Entrance is FREE!

A must for family picnics and to take the kids. This Park has two play areas for different ages of children. Very popular over the weekends as the kids of all ages play on their bikes as well as the parks with all types of activities.You'll see many families holding birthday parties there as well as all ages having picnics. Secure and safe and a walk to the beach area.

Loved the park..... Fantastic day in the park... My son was able to ride his bike safely .... Kept me running for hours... Awesome or or a picnic and loved the outside gym area.. Watched them for hours..heh heh

Built for relaxation and studies. Off the Greenpoint-Stadium there is this unexpected park with an offering of diversity, that i have to list them below, and all are worth visiting- public park, open with sunrise and sundown- perfect for jogging- dogs allowed on leach- different playgrounds for children age-depending- sailing-lake- garden of herbs with learning-boards- garden of indigenous plants with learning-boards- maze - greens for weekend gathering - security (of course)- waterplays + fishponds- seating-area and benches all around for restsTry it, its a wonderful little oasis between the busy regent + beach road

Wonderful! well done Cape Town. We live 5 minutes away from the park and our son goes there every morning to play in the toddlers play area - it's just wonderful - great for kids to have a play with other's the same age - the city have really made an effort with this park. We love it - thank you.

Fab for kids. With two amazing parks for kids of different ages, great running trails (kids can use on their bikes) and carefully considered planting and maintenance, this is an excellent spot for a morning of fresh air with your kids. Small cafe has just opened at the bigger kids' park (very close to the toddler park), which is great for moms desperate for a coffee and snacks. Super safe and clean.

What a surprise. One of the best things to come out of the 2010 World Cup. So much thought has been put into it's design and it is a joy to walk around the biodiversity garden and so informative. It is safe and lots of friendly security attendants. This will be a truly outstanding park as it matures and Capetonians should feel proud of it.

Fun for the whole family. This is the ideal picnic spot in the middle of cape town. whether you just want to relax and read a book, or play with the kids, you are sure to find a perfect spot...well maintained...pity there is limited parking...so go early

Undoubtedly the best urban park in South Africa!. This is the most eco-friendly and amazing urban park. Very informative - especially if you have children.They have a great deal of information presented in a fun and interesting way!Lots of activities, from an out-door gym, sun dial, a coffee shop, walking trails... its just plain awesome.A MUST!

GREEN POINT. Definitely a last on your itinary. Nothing exciting depends on what you like. Do your homework before you visit Green Point .
Overrated
Magical!. Stumbled upon this park by accident, and are so glad we did. What a beautiful and informative educational resource for the community! Well-written interpretive information.

quiet picnic site. The park is a great addition to Green point. It is quite big, has couple of ponds and a biodiversity walk explaining and showing different plants and such. It also has multiple playgrounds for kids and picnic tables and some gym equipment. Generally quiet, good place to spend some time.

Great outing with and without kids. The kids had a ball, and we loved the family-friendly vibe. It was a bit windy, but very worth it. Also liked the separate play area for younger toddlers. Will definitely be back.

A new gem by the sea. Part of the legacy of the 2010 FIFA World Cup, this park has been a great success. Built around a wetland area, the park showcases rare coastal vegetation in the Biodiversity garden and provides lawns and picnic areas which are popular with families on weekends.

Great family venue. This was really interesting! There was a blustering south easter but we enjoyed it anyway. Found the info on plants in the Cape. Hundreds of school children on the weekday we were there, people having picnics. Great place to wind down.

Great for summer strolls with the kids.. This is a very laid-back place near the Cape Town Stadium. It is for all ages. Kids can ride their bikes (and stroller skates??) while mom and dad recline on the grass. Easy walking. It can get windy, as the trees are still relatively young and don't provide much protection. Great views of the mountain, giving the effect of vast expanses of "freedom" and openess.

Wonderful venue for family to spend time in nature. I love the safety and all the activities for children. For those who have not got children can stroll around the park and enjoy the beauty of nature, without being disturbed by the children's playing

Green Oasis. This is a great spot to relax between appointments in the city. Normally very quiet on a weekday, busier with families over the weekend. A good way to learn about plants and the environment as well.

An hidden treasure. If you want to chill out and relax in the City there is no better place to go than this park. Safe ,central ,interesting and a great place to exercise,walk relax. Do go and you will pleased that you made the time and effort to find it.

A place of relaxation and great for family time. I really love this park ,it's great for picnics with family and friends. Great activities for the kids as well . In summer there is very little shade so come prepared.also bring your picnics and relax and enjoy the beautiful surroundings
Worth a short visit. Worth a short visit to get a good idea of the ecology of the area around Cape Town. Particlularly good for children, but also for adults

Gorgeous outdoor park!. Magnificent views of Signal Hill and Table Mountain, as well as the 2010 World Cup Stadium - perfect for walks, a run through and especially for the kids! Restaurants and coffee bars as well as the Mouille Point beach front close by!

cute little guesthouse top of the hill overlooking the stadium,bay the biodiversity park of greenpark in the distance. Green Point has many g8 Guesthouses. Bluegumhill Guesthouse is small, charming with Cape Town character right on the top of Signal Hill, situated in a quiet cul de sac, overlooking the whole bay,stadium, the V&A Waterfront,the Green Point Common and the Metropolitan Colf Course. It us a family owned guesthouse with a personal intimate customer relation attitude. You sit on the balcony or at the pool with a panoramic view in front of you.

Breathtaking Oasis. We were taken aback at the beauty of this park, didn't expect it to be as great as it was. The diversity of plantings, the humour of the descriptions, and written history of the area were amazing. Against the backdrop of the mountains, with families playing nearby on fields, it was an oasis in the midst of the city. Birds, ducks, all sorts of small insects, water features, make it a peaceful haven. We spent hours there, found the medicine garden very interesting, and the Khoi Khoi huts.
Beautiful and unexpected park. This park is tucked away and quite unexpected. Most locals dont even know its there. Great for families and children.. Definitely worth a visit
Inner City Sanctuary. Having lived in Cape Town for a few years now, it was lovely to discover this park with so many ammenities. The kids play areas in particular are world class

Great attention to detail. An excellent park, well situated and well designed and executed, with great attention to important issues of conservation & re-cycling. Fabulous for children of all ages and very comfortable and attractive for parents too.
Great holiday or Sunday outing. Fabulous for a walk around. Lovely flowers and plant information. Good for feeding the soul with the wonderful views of the mountain.

Unbelievable.. What has been achieved to create this super park, is amazing.What was once a golf course together with an area of desolate wastland, has been transformed into a wonderfull leasure area.The Biodiversity Garden is beautifully laid out, and there is so much information at hand.Well worth a visit. Take a lunch box and enjoy a day out. If you have youngsters, the play areqas are a kids paradise.

Fabulous Facility for young and old. An extremely well kept and managed park with walkways, lakes , ducks, seagulls and amazing selection of indigenous flora and fauna.
Enough space for families to picnic, children to place and seating all around the park. Absolutely stunning.

I am from Sydney and I reckon Cape Town beats Sydney hands down. This is arguably the most scenic and beautiful city in the world! Table Mountain wherever you go. We may have the Harbour Bridge but it cannot be seen from everywhere. Robben Island - living history and so inspiring. Stellenbosch wines and wineries amazing.Malaysian district great houses and food.Scenic waterfront. Outstanding accommodation and location and so convenient.I loved Cape Town.
Love the layout. We had our church end of year picnic there and used the MyCiti bus to get there from Table View and Milnerton. Quite a walk bur worth it.
Friday. Every Friday we have a social run with work friends. We always choose to run through Greenpoint park. It is beautiful and frequented by families and strollers. Such a benefit to our city.

see the real africa. we spent a day here walking and driving around. the info centre is very helpful to visit before you start your day. we saw dolphins in the sea, babboons running around, a bit scary but if you do as the guide tells you and keep your car doors closed they are lovely to see. we also saw some ostrich in their own environment. a wonderful memory
Amazing Oasis. Wonderful oasis so close to the city. Well kept, ideal for families, dog owners and cyclists. A great day out!

Way cool place.... I've been to this park on a number of occassions and must let you know that it is extremely wheelchair accessible. There are disabled parking bays on the Virgin active side of the park, easy access into the park. Getting around is via paved walk ways and ensures a good work out! :) Some nice area's with benches where you can just relax and have a picnic. This is well worth a visit if your in the area.

Greenpoint Park. This park is kept in pristine condition. It is well worth having a picnic, a small function, or just a walk. It is adjacent to a golf course and the 2010 soccer world cup stadium. Well worth a visit!

Relaxing + plant info. I actually brought kids here for a fieldtrip. There are notes on medicinal plants, plants used for food, etc. The park has an awesome playground and benches to relax with your book. There is a huge sundial and the kids really enjoyed themselves.

Perfect for families. This is an incredible place to take children 12 and under. Very diverse ethnically. A wide variety of play equipment that it well kept. Perfect for picnics or family gatherings or just an impromptu play in the park. Incredible views.
Wow. A MUST visit! Go for a picnic or just take the kids to play. Well kept - a little oasis in the City

Wonderful place for children. Definitely the best freebie in Cape Town! It is a beautifully set out park. Two play areas for children, one especially for younger children, which is enclosed. Most of the play equipment is made from alien vegetation, with some different things to play on. The 'garden' parts of the park are all indigenous plants and education as they highlight plants suitable for different areas. Children love it! Only down side is no food or drink available on site.

Love this place! Perfect for a picnic. Beautiful park for kids with many play areas. Had hours of fun with my son there. There are also many benches where you can sit and even picnic on the grass. There was security in the park and it was a great experience to visit.

Perfect park for children. This park is absolutely wonderful for children! It is safe, convenient located in Greenpoint and has the most amazing playground. Large open spaces and great information about our Fynbos!

do not visit cape town without visiting this park. we have rented an apartment overlooking this park. It is amazing. It is a feat. It has a biodiversity section, a gym section, a lake a view to the stadium and is so so safe. I go there every day and was so nervous about going back to sa. I love it and feel so safe. It has won awards. Dont miss it. There is a HUGe park for kids - it is packed on weekends - so must work for kids.

Great addition to life in Cape Town!. This park was a spin-off from the 2010 World Cup Soccer and it's a lovely spot for families, walks, sitting in the sun, being educated from the bio-diversity gardens and just admiring the wonderful views.It's a truly relaxing spot and already well-loved by many Capetonians.Visitors to the city can enjoy a peaceful stroll with stunning views as a break from their hectic schedule.
Garden of Peace. Various Cape plant species to be seen - gardens beautifully laid out - not too busy and easy access - certainly the place to be to experience some quiet peaceful moments!

A must for every age.. I visited the gardens on Sunday, the weather was stunning, since my last visit about eight months ago the plants have grown and birds have made their homes in the trees, and we saw butterflies and bees. I took my elderly parents, they couldnt stop raving, there were plenty of seats for them to sit on and watch the children in the play area. Families were having their lunch at the wooden tables next to the water, others were relaxing on the beautiful lawns. The toilets were clean, there was plenty of security and we found parking in the parking area next to the Virgin Active Gym. The backdrop of Table Mountain, and signal hill just add to the beauty. We would have liked a cup of tea and cake, but there wasnt anything in the garden so take your own flask or walk to the main roads to get something to eat.

Fantastic Family Day Out. A great place to picnic. Clean toilets. Security are on the ball. The parks and entire area is fab for the children and even a romantic picnic. Really a great experience. Only downside is that the parking area is a bit manic!

Colourful, serene & absolutley breathtaking *-*. The layout of this park & garden are just one of its kind..Fynbos & fauna so diverse and the well defined and discriptiveboards where one can read all about the herbs their origins etc...I love the meandering streams of water trickling along the paths.The beautiful iconic Table Mountain...on the one side and the historic 2010 soccer world stadium on the otherA beautiful peaceful place to enjoy if you need a stress reliever ot just want to enjoy a quite day!!

perfect break from the busy city. all the children I au pair love the greenpoint park.They spend hours on the swings, slides and anthing else they can climb on or jump off!The jungle gyms are made from cool recycled materials and very cleverly use the space. The park is safe- with seperate play areas for children under 4.This is especially great- because the equipment isnt so high and is easier for the younger children to interact with on their own.There is also a section of the park with adult exercise equipment- so you can easily get a quick work out whilst your children play.Lots of young families are in the park in the early evening and there is a lovely community atmosphere.

A scenic open space with multiple uses. A scenic place to relax with lots of place for children to run around as well as a fun and unusual play area with jungle gym, swings etc. Ideal for picnicking either on the grass or at picnic tables provided. For the more fitness-focused the park is ideal for joggers and even has outdoor gym equipment. It's proximity to the city makes it ideal to piggyback it with other attractions nearby. Free access is another major plus.

Great for visit for the entire family. Great for walks, the kids can play on some awesome and very cleverly constructed jungle gyms. If you like exercise, run there and find an array of gym apparatus to exercise on. The run along the Atlantic Ocean Promenade is one of the most beautiful in the world.

A breath of fresh air so close to the city!. Lovely outdoor venue for a picnic, a walk, or a trip out with the little ones to let off some energy.Beautiful jungle gyms for the little ones and even outdoor exercise equipment for mom and dad or solo/group adult visitors.The garden is also lovely to explore, though the park can get busy and very noisy on good weather days. Late evenings from about an hour prior to closing time seems to suit me best, as it's pretty quiet then.All in all, definitely worth visiting if you're in or around Cape Town CBD, especially with little ones.

piece in the middle of the hustle and bustle. if you are looking for a place to clear your mind, and forget about your worries for a little while then go to the park. Lovely walk ways, great for people with kids, clean and safe.
I love this park. Open spaces, world class jungle gyms, fantastic fitness gym. My kids LOVE it there!!

Love this park!. This park is really something special, we love walking there and the kids love running and playing. It is very child-friendly and a good idea is to pack a picnic and sit on the lawns.

It's amazing. The park is super nice, especially at sunset. I run through here often and each time is like a moment frozen in time. Highly recommend spending some time in the park, then pass over to Neo for some eats.

beautiful. What a lovely place. Walked through here on our way to seapoint and found it a very relaxing place . Lots of familys on sundays with there picnics and bbq's and views in every direction. Some days saw school children here with there teachers having lessons about the plants.

A beautiful garden close to the Cape Town Stadium. The Greenpoint Park was the fruits of the 2010 FIFA Soccer World Cup. Local families regularly enjoy their day picnics in the park. I recommend it to all as part of your visit to Cape Town. There is so much to do in the park, especially for children. If you are alone you could spend several hours walking through the biodiversity garden and park.

nice place to bike, run, or wander.. Our hotel was right out one of the gates of the park, so it was a wonderful place to run, bike or wander around. What a nice resource right in the center of the city -- kind of like a miniature Central Park in Manhattan.

Stunning City Park. What a wonderful place for everyone to go and enjoy both the floral and social diversity of Cape Town. Don't miss it if you want to hang out with locals enjoying their Sunday picnics. A very chilled experience which you can beef up with a bash at the outdoor exercise equipment or an educational stroll through the specially designed walk-through garden. This place makes me so proud to be a Capetonian! Another locals haunt, Newport Cafe, is a stones throw away on Beach Road and great for either making up your own picnic from their deli or slipping into a near-coma over cake and coffee.

Peaceful park in cape town. This is a lovely place to bring little children, teenagers, old people...anybody! Its peasceful, wellmarked, beautiful. Whether you need to just take a stroll outside or want to learn something about our flora, this is a lovely place to come to. It is much smaller than Kirstenbosch and more accessable.

Great for lazy weekenders like myself.. There are so many things for children to do at this particular park!! Adults have the chance to read the newspaper , chill and just relax whilst the kids have fun. Several good restaurants nearby mean that you can either have breakfast before going into the park, lunch afterwards or a great cappuccino in between. My personal favourite Cafe Neo opposite the Lighthouse in Greenpoint !!
a little gem. layout - diversity of indigenous plants - well labellededucational aspects - very informativeCharming little beaded insects, etc. well positionedFree ConcertsHas appeal to all ages
Beautiful. A fabulous 'new space' made from what was a wasteland. Beautiful walks for all ages. Lots to see and do - lovely parks for the kids.
Could be a daily walk.. Major display of extraordinary folliage and flowers. Each season will differ but a wonderful way to spend a morning relaxing.
Peace and quiet. In the middle of the bustling city this gem of peace and quiet lies - well worth a visit

A very beautiful park... full of life during weekend! Good for families and children. The park is very beautiful and walking around will be a quite interesting experience.You can learn something (from the biodiversity walk area), spot the beautiful stadium, see people playing cricket, baseball, etc... children and you can also assist from a distance to a birthday party... Maybe not a "must see" of Cape Town but iIt's a place worth a visit with a camera.

Wonderful legacy.. The park was one of the upgrades we got from the 2010 soccer event and not being a soccer fan,at least I can enjoy this beautiful,lush green space and hope to do so,and see the plants grow and mature over the years to come.Well worth a visit when in Cape town.
lush. nice scenic and very pretty, must visit if family and kids are there with you
Amazing abundance of green in city. An amazing abundance of green well worth a stroll through, right in the heart of the city, all with the backdrop of the stunning Greenpoint stadium.
New park. launched after the Soccer World Cup in 2010. Nice, tranquil environment, good for a Sunday vibe! even on a Monday!
Beautiful Public Space. Beautiful Public Space to go for a walk or picnic.. clean and safe
Just Amazing!. SO worth a visit - truly an amazing spot and next to our stadium.
It's so green. What a difference since the World Cup, the Green Point common has gone green, it's a great place for the whole family to walk around.
Wonderful outdoors in the heart of Cape Town. Lovely venue to stroll safely, and enjoy nature. Quite a good idea as the stadium is merely a white elephant after the famous World Cup
Birdwatchers delight. Great for birdwatching, not crowded. Wonderful walks through the gardens and a good little cafe

Away from the City in the City. By Cape Town standards this is one of the best parks for nature lovers, plain lovers and families with kids. The park accommodates walkers, cyclists (kiddies), ball games, joggers and those that just want to relax with a picnic basket and breathe in the fresh air.

Fun, picnic, educational. Great for a sunny or overcast day, with a superb park for children and toddlers. Beautiful, well kept gardens and little creatures hidding amongst the wild flowers. Lovely for a picnic, bike riding and fun for the family.

just gorgeous. This newly established park is really spectacular. Around every corner is another surprise, something interesting to see or read or comment on. The childrens play area is safe and great fun - there really is no other place like this in Cape Town. Kids just go wild here and can do so in a safe environment. Security is tight and the gardens are clean and well maintained. This is a favourite with the locals.

New Gem in Cape Town. This area is full of surprises. Lovely area for kids to enjoy, beautiful pathways to walk in and great picnics to be had in the park. Alcohol free zone. One street away from the beachfront and close to the V&A Waterfront.

Lovely greenspace. If you are parents who want see your children enjoying themselves along footpaths that curve around flower beds, If you are offspring wanting to take your wheelchair bound parets for a "walk",if you are lovers who enjoy a relaxed atmosphereif you are alone and want to sit on a bech watching the passing parade, this one is for you. security here is of a high standard.

Great new park for the city as part of the World Cup legacy. Cape Town's newest park is a delightful spot to visit for a walk. They have created a wonderful indigenous garden to stroll through, large grassy areas for picnics and a wonderful exercise area with interactive equipment. The views from the gardens include Table Mountain and you are at the footstep of the World Cup Stadium - it is a great spot for taking pictures. Parking is fairly easy - head along the beach road in Moulle Point and park and walk through. It is great to combine a walk with a visit to one of the little restaurants in the area - so plan on a coffee and Cafe Neo afterwards next to the lighthouse or head to Newport Deli to stock up with great breads, cheeses and meats and then head into the gardens for a picnic! It is a wonderful area for relaxation and a great addition to the city
